learning_outcomes.description: ANALYTICAL: Apply fundamental principles and analysis techniques to identify, idealize and solve advanced problems in structural engineering.
CONCEPTUAL: Understand the fundamental concepts in structural mechanics and analysis and transform analysis results to design scenarios.
CRITICAL THINKING: Compare, evaluate and query analysis results and develop insight into structural response under various actions.

assessments.due_date:
Assignment 1 - weighted residual integral 18/08/2025 5:00 pm

Assignment 2 - beam deflection 25/08/2025 5:00 pm

Assignment 3 - FEM formulation 1/09/2025 5:00 pm

Assignment 4 - axial bar element 8/09/2025 5:00 pm

Assignment 5 - heat transfer 15/09/2025 5:00 pm

Assignment 6 - Euler-Bernoulli beam element 22/09/2025 5:00 pm

Assignment 7 - Eigenvalue problem (beam vibration) 7/10/2025 5:00 pm

Assignment 8 - Eigenvalue problem (column buckling) 13/10/2025 5:00 pm

Assignment 9 - two-dimensional plate exact analysis 20/10/2025 5:00 pm

Assignment 10 - two dimension plate FEM analysis 27/10/2025 5:00 pm
assessments.task_description:
Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. 

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assessment must be submitted through the course BlackBoard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The final exam will include conventional problem-solving calculation questions.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Theory of Finite Element Method (FEM) (Lecture & Tutorial Series): Weighted residual; Interpolation function; Linear, quadratic and cubic elements; Weak form; Matrix representation of ODE in weak form; Approximation of second-order ODE; Eigenvalue problem

Theory of FEM on structural beams & frames frames, dynamics and heat transfer problem


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
